page.title: 13SHEFFORD BREWERY
page.content:
We went to visit Banks and Taylor, the {Shefford brewery. }They were founded n 1982 and make four kinds of beer - Shefford Bitter, SPA, Eastcote Ale and SOS.
The first thing we saw was the grist mill where the melted barley is ground up and fed into the mash tun with lots of hot water. This is called sparging. The liquor then goes to a huge copper where hops are added and it is heated. Then it is cooled and piped into the fermentation vessel with a whole bucket of yeast and left there for about a week until it has turned into beer.
